parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests that this might not be official electoral propaganda from a registered candidate or party.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post does not explicitly mention any specific parliamentary candidate by name or surname.  The post is associated with RMDSZ (Uniunea Democrată Maghiară din România), a political party, but doesn't directly endorse or attack any individual candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently targeting a wide audience. The use of Facebook as a platform and the paid nature of the post indicate an intention to reach a large number of people.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary message "VASÁRNAP SZAVAZOK!" (Sunday I vote!) strongly suggests an electoral objective. The accompanying text emphasizes the importance of voting for Hungarians in Romania, implying a call to action to vote for a party (RMDSZ) that represents their interests. This is a clear attempt to influence voter turnout for a specific political party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The content is not journalistic in nature. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it presents a partisan appeal to a specific community to participate in the election, promoting a particular party's agenda.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; rather, it promotes a political party's interests and encourages voting for that party. The language used is not personal but rather a direct appeal to a specific demographic.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>467703365924245</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while not explicitly naming a candidate, strongly promotes RMDSZ and encourages voting for the party. The paid nature of the advertisement, its broad reach, and the clear call to action ("Sunday I vote!") all point towards electoral propaganda.  The absence of a CMF number is a mitigating factor, but the overall message and intent are clearly aimed at influencing the election.  The targeting of specific locations with significant Hungarian populations further strengthens this conclusion.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>RMDSZ</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>RMDSZ</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook cu ID-ul 467703365924245, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care conține mesajul "VASÁRNAP SZAVAZOK!",  încurajând votul pentru RMDSZ și subliniind importanța participării electorale pentru comunitatea maghiară din România.  Efectul electoral este clar, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului în favoarea RMDSZ.  Postarea, deși nu menționează candidați individuali, are un caracter propagandistic evident, vizând o audiență largă prin intermediul unei campanii plătite (RON100-RON199), cu o estimare a impactului de peste 1 milion de persoane, ținând cont de localizarea geografică specifică.  Textul însoțitor accentuează riscurile pentru comunitatea maghiară și necesitatea votului pentru a asigura reprezentarea acesteia.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
